1.text: And Eliphaz the Temanite will answer and say,

2.text: Trying the word to thee shalt thou be weary? who shall be able to with hold in speaking?

3.text: Behold, thou didst instruct many, and thou wilt strengthen the weak hands.

4.text: Thy words will raise up the weak and thou wilt strengthen the bent knees.

5.text: But now it shall come to thee and thou wilt be wearied; it will touch even to thee, and thou wilt tremble.

6.text: Is not thy fear, thy confidence, thy hope, and the integrity of thy ways?

7.text: Remember now, who perished, he being innocent? and where were the upright cut off?

8.text: According to what I saw, they ploughing iniquity and sowing labor shall reap it.

9.text: By the breath of God they shall perish, and from the spirit of his anger they shall be finished.

10.text: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the lion, and the teeth of the young lions were broken.

11.text: The lion perished from failure of prey, and the sons of the lioness shall be scattered.

12.text: And a word shall be brought to me by stealth, and mine ear will take a transient sound from it.

13.text: In thoughts, from visions of the night, in the falling of deep sleep upon men,

14.text: Fear met me, and trembling, and caused the multitude of my bones to tremble.

15.text: And the spirit will glide before my face; the hair of my flesh will stand erect:

16.text: It will stand, and I shall not recognize its appearance: a form before mine eyes; I shall hear stillness and a voice:

17.text: Shall a man be just above God? If a man shall be pure above him making him?

18.text: Behold, in his servants he will not trust, and upon his messengers he will set folly:

19.text: Also those dwelling in houses of clay which their foundation in the dust, being crushed before the moth.

20.text: From morning to evening they will be struck; from not setting to superintend they will perish.

21.text: Did not their remainder in them remove? They will die, and not in wisdom.
